column4: For a somewhat old computer with a 600 MHz Pentium 3 processor and 384 MB of RAM, which I'm setting up for a user with no prior Linux experience, would GNOME or KDE be feasible?
Or would Xfce be better given the limited resources?
I would say so. I don't run on that much memory and gnome works well
The important thing is the swap is big. 500 mb is good
